_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Miscellaneous Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing
All Other Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing
All Other Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies: The facility's overall approach and commitment to chemical safety is demonstrated by the implementation of OSHA Process Safety Management ("PSM") procedures.  The facility management ensures that facility personnel continue to adhere to these safety procedures.

Facility and Regulated Substances Handled: The OSRAM SYLVANIA Products Inc. ("OSRAM") Towanda facility manufactures specialized materials for the cutting tools, lighting and automotive industries.  The facility is subject to Clean Air Act Section 112(r)(7), and the corresponding regulations at 40 C.F.R. Part 68, because of the on-site storage of anhydrous ammonia, hydrogen and aqueous ammonia.  The anhydrous ammonia and hydrogen storage operations comply with Prevention Program 3 of the Risk Management Plan ("RMP"), and the aqueous ammonia operations comply with the Prevention Program 2. 

General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps: The facility has developed and instituted procedures to prevent and effectively respond to any accidental releases from the processes.  These procedures were developed in accordance with both the OSHA PSM standards in 29 C.F.R. 1910.119 and RMP 40 C.F.R. Part 68 requirements.  The facility regularly trains personnel who are responsible for operating and maintaining the processes, both in the classroom and on the job.  Additionally, the anhydrous ammonia storage system complies with OSHA's storage and handling requirements set forth in 29 C.F.R. 1910.11.  An outside supplier who incorporates safe procedures maintains the hydrogen storage and supply system.

Five-Year Accident History: The facility has had no RMP-reportable incidents of anhydrous ammonia, hydrogen and aqueous ammonia since the submission of the last RMP.

Emergency Response Program: The facility has an existing emergency response plan that contains emergency response and coordination procedures for releases from t

he anhydrous ammonia, hydrogen and aqueous ammonia processes.  This plan coordinates emergency response efforts with the local fire department and local planning commission. 

Planned Changes to Improve Safety: The facility periodically reviews the program, training and maintenance procedures to identify any necessary changes that would improve safety at the facility.  Pursuant to this review procedure, the facility recently completed the following items   On the anhydrous ammonia storage tanks, OSRAM installed isolation valves at the flanged level  transmitter vessel connections , installed a replacement valve bonnet on liquid to service valve, installed a replacement valve bonnet on manual pressure build valve and removed and replace the check valve at tank in manual pressure build line as well as installed an isolation valve.  In the vaporizer building installed limiting restricting orifice plates in the line to each anhydrous ammonia vaporizer and full line bore plates in the vapor discharge lines.  Also replaced a PRV device on one of the vaporizer units.    On the aqueous ammonia storage tanks installed a safety relief valve manifold and a second relief valve at the aqueous make up tank and service tank.
